@graph.name: Khaman Dhokla - chickpea flour steamed savory snack cakes. glutenfree vegan - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: A lot of indian meals and snacks just happen to be naturally glutenfree, like these khaman Dhokla - A traditional Indian snack

itemListElement.name: Khaman Dhokla – chickpea flour steamed savory snack cakes. glutenfree vegan

@graph.name: Khaman Dhokla - chickpea flour steamed savory snack cakes
recipeIngredient: generous pinch of turmeric (optional, just for a brighter yellow color)
1 teaspoon grated ginger or 1/2 tsp paste
3 Tablespoons non dairy yogurt (I used SoDelicious plain coconut milk yogurt)
a generous pinch of baking soda

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk all the dry ingredients of the dhokla well.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk all the dry ingredients of the dhokla well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the grated or paste ginger and chili and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the grated or paste ginger and chili and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, Whisk the yogurt, water and vinegar to remove lumps and combine well.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, Whisk the yogurt, water and vinegar to remove lumps and combine well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the yogurt mix into the dry ingredients and mix/whisk to form a lump free flowy, not too watery, batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the yogurt mix into the dry ingredients and mix/whisk to form a lump free flowy, not too watery, batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pinch of baking soda into the dhokla batter when ready to steam, mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the pinch of baking soda into the dhokla batter when ready to steam, mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Immediately pour the batter into the parchment lined baking pan and steam it in any way you find comfortable.
recipeInstructions.name: Immediately pour the batter into the parchment lined baking pan and steam it in any way you find comfortable.

recipeInstructions.text: I usually use my 6 inch round steel pan and steam in a pressure cooker without whistle. But not everyone has a pressure cooker, I used a deep pan(steamer set up) with a well fitting lid, the lid has a hole. I used a non stick 6 by 3 inch baking pan lined with parchment for the dhokla cake.
recipeInstructions.name: I usually use my 6 inch round steel pan and steam in a pressure cooker without whistle. But not everyone has a pressure cooker, I used a deep pan(steamer set up) with a well fitting lid, the lid has a hole. I used a non stick 6 by 3 inch baking pan lined with parchment for the dhokla cake.

recipeInstructions.text: This baking pan can be put in any steamer and steamed for 22-24 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: This baking pan can be put in any steamer and steamed for 22-24 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: I filled up the deep pan with water that reached to about 2/3 the height of the baking pan.
recipeInstructions.name: I filled up the deep pan with water that reached to about 2/3 the height of the baking pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the water starts boiling, add the pinch of baking soda into the dhokla batter and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the water starts boiling, add the pinch of baking soda into the dhokla batter and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Immediately pour the batter into the parchment lined dhokla pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Immediately pour the batter into the parchment lined dhokla pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dhokla pan in boiling water, cover and steam on high flame for 18-20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dhokla pan in boiling water, cover and steam on high flame for 18-20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Check on the 18 minute mark, a tooth pick from the center should come out almost clean. Cook for another 2-3 minutes and switch off.
recipeInstructions.name: Check on the 18 minute mark, a tooth pick from the center should come out almost clean. Cook for another 2-3 minutes and switch off.

recipeInstructions.text: After a minute, Take the dhokla pan out of the steamer pan and let rest for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: After a minute, Take the dhokla pan out of the steamer pan and let rest for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove parchment from pan and rest for another 5 minutes before peeling off the parchment. You can also use a greased pan, and using a knife loosen the edges.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove parchment from pan and rest for another 5 minutes before peeling off the parchment. You can also use a greased pan, and using a knife loosen the edges.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the dhokla into squares or rectangles.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the dhokla into squares or rectangles.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a small pan on medium heat.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a small pan on medium heat.

itemListElement.text: When hot add the mustard seeds and wait for them to sputter.
itemListElement.name: When hot add the mustard seeds and wait for them to sputter.

itemListElement.text: Add in the asofetida(hing) and curry leaves and reduce heat to low. You can add the chopped cilantro now and cook it for a few seconds, or use it uncooked as garnish.
itemListElement.name: Add in the asofetida(hing) and curry leaves and reduce heat to low. You can add the chopped cilantro now and cook it for a few seconds, or use it uncooked as garnish.

itemListElement.text: Add half a teaspoon of chopped green chili(optional)
itemListElement.name: Add half a teaspoon of chopped green chili(optional)

itemListElement.text: In a bowl, mix the lemon juice, water and sugar and add this carefully to the pan.
itemListElement.name: In a bowl, mix the lemon juice, water and sugar and add this carefully to the pan.

itemListElement.text: Mix well and turn heat off. Pour this over evenly the cut dhokla.
itemListElement.name: Mix well and turn heat off. Pour this over evenly the cut dhokla.

itemListElement.text: Garnish with coconut, sesame seeds, cilantro. Serve, with sweet tamarind date chutney or green cilantro mint chutney.
itemListElement.name: Garnish with coconut, sesame seeds, cilantro. Serve, with sweet tamarind date chutney or green cilantro mint chutney.
